result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Cashmore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David R Cashmore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David R Cashmore was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • David R Cashmore was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNT ONE AND THREE:  Concurrent.  Huber privileges for treatment. Court recommends against electronic surveillance.  Credit for five days.
Defendant enters into Veterans Treatment Initiative Program (VT) with the sentencing deferred.  Deferred Sentencing Agreement received and filed.

miscConds.notes:
COUNT ONE:  Fine of $600.00.
BOTH COUNTS:  Costs, penalties and surcharges.  To be paid during probation or a civil judgment will be enterd with tax intercept .  Bail to apply, if applicable.
**10/21/2015  Court wavied DNA surcharge as to count one only.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random  urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  No drugs or alcohol.

miscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.

Defendant David R Cashmore in court with attorney Thomas J Marola.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.   Defense request for an adjournment is denied.

VTI COURT - DSA
AS TO COUNT 1 & 3
Parties are prepared to enter into a Deferred Sentencing Agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty and entered Judgment of Conviction as charged in the Information.  Defendant enters into Veterans Treatment Initiative Program (VTI) with the sentencing deferred.  Deferred Sentencing Agreement received and filed.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
As operation of law, court ordered count 2 dismissed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1 & 3 - CONCURRENT:
Defendant sentenced to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges for treatment.  Court recommends against Electronic Surveillance.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, forthwith.  Release
   for treatment.
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 165 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.
* Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 24 months. 

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan;

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant David R Cashmore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant David R Cashmore in custody.  William Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
